p: Higher tumor mutation burden (TMB) and somatic mutation rates are correlated to stronger anti-cancer immunity [ 28]. Therefore, we calculated the TMB and mutations in each patient using the mutect2-processed mutation dataset of TCGA, and analyzed the same in all immune subtypes. As shown in Fig.Â 5a, IS4 and IS5 showed significantly higher TMB compared to IS1, IS2 and IS3. Similar trends were seen with the number of mutated genes as well (Fig. 5b ). Furthermore, 11 genes including KRAS were most frequently mutated in each subtype (Fig. 5c ). These findings suggest that the immune subtype can predict TMB and somatic mutation rates in PAAD patients, and that patients with IS4 and IS5 may respond positively to the mRNA vaccine.
